dt: {bc}a cramping and oppressive lack of resources (such as money)

pt: {sc}poverty{/sc} {sc}indigence{/sc} {sc}penury{/sc} {sc}want{/sc} {sc}destitution{/sc} mean the state of one with insufficient resources. {sc}poverty{/sc} may cover a range from extreme want of necessities to an absence of material comforts.

pt.t: the extreme {it}poverty{/it} of the slum dwellers
the {it}indigence{/it} of her years as a graduate student

pt: {sc}penury{/sc} suggests a cramping or oppressive lack of money.

pt.t: a catastrophic illness that condemned them to years of {it}penury{/it}

pt: {sc}want{/sc} and {sc}destitution{/sc} imply extreme poverty that threatens life itself through starvation or exposure.

pt.t: lived in a perpetual state of {it}want{/it}
the widespread {it}destitution{/it} in countries beset by famine

et: Middle English, from Latin {it}penuria, paenuria{/it} want; perhaps akin to Latin {it}paene{/it} almost
shortdef: a cramping and oppressive lack of resources (such as money); especially : severe poverty
